item.title: Data Visualization: Inequality of COVID-19 Vaccinations
item.description: As developed countries head for booster shots, a rising concern on the inequality of COVID-19 vaccines distributions is coming to surface. Is this concern, however, exaggerated? Well… It’s not. As Portugal nears 75% of full vaccination rates on its population, there are still countries not reaching 1%. Perhaps unsurprisingly, African countries rate among the worse, as only 3% of the continent’s population is fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Issues of morality The World Health Organization has already caught up on this issue, with its head Tedros Ghebreyesus stating that it’s unacceptable that countries which have used most of the global supply of vaccines keep using even more of it.
